summary: This document is an invitation from ECPAT-USA for a virtual discussion about Jeffrey Epstein featuring a documentary director, a psychologist, a survivor/board member, and moderated by the organization's executive director. The event promotes a Netflix docuseries examining Epstein's use of wealth and power to carry out abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Convicted sex offender, subject of discussion
persons.context: The central subject of the event and docuseries, described as using his wealth and power to carry out sexual abuses.

persons.name: Lisa Bryant
persons.context: Featured as a director, presumably of the docuseries "Filthy Rich" being discussed.

persons.name: Kathryn Stamoulis
persons.context: Featured as a psychologist participating in the discussion about Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Fernando Camacho
persons.role: Survivor and ECPAT-USA Board Member, Honorable
persons.context: Identified as a survivor and board member participating in the discussion panel.

persons.name: Lori L. Cohen
persons.context: Moderating the virtual discussion event about Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Camacho is identified as a survivor in the context of a discussion about Epstein's abuses.
Cohen, as Executive Director of ECPAT-USA, is moderating a panel that includes board member Camacho.
Bryant is a director of a docuseries that examines Epstein and his crimes.

events.title: ECPAT-USA Virtual Discussion on Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A Zoom event featuring a panel discussion about convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, promoting the Netflix docuseries "Filthy Rich".

keyFacts: The document is an invitation for a public discussion about Jeffrey Epstein hosted by the anti-trafficking organization ECPAT-USA.
The event features Fernando Camacho, identified as both a survivor and a board member of ECPAT-USA.
The discussion is tied to the Netflix docuseries "Filthy Rich", which examines how Epstein used wealth and power to carry out abuse.
The event reflects ongoing public and organizational efforts to analyze and discuss the Epstein case years after his death.
